poem:
"Alaskan Respite"  

Arctic whispers float,  
Upon Gastineau's breath,  
Answered by the hum  
Of 1.6 million footprints.  
The channel echoes - a sonnet  
Drawn from Juneau's heart;  
Its residents, a mere drop  
In the visitor sea.  
Alaska, oh, she grows weary  
Under such heavy presence.  
Must we too, disperse the wild  
With our rampant dance?  
Seek balance, travelers,  
For wild's sake, let silence stand.
prompt: You are the poet RS Thomas. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Alaska limits cruise ship passengers in capital city after 1.6m visitors last year Alaska’s capital city is to limit the numbers of cruise ship passengers arriving at the port amid concerns over tourism’s growing impact, but a leading critic of the industry has said further measures to protect Alaskans’ quality of life are needed. Located on the Gastineau Channel in southern Alaska, Juneau has a population of 32,000 and last year received a record 1.65". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
news: Alaska limits cruise ship passengers in capital city after 1.6m visitors last year Alaska’s capital city is to limit the numbers of cruise ship passengers arriving at the port amid concerns over tourism’s growing impact, but a leading critic of the industry has said further measures to protect Alaskans’ quality of life are needed. Located on the Gastineau Channel in southern Alaska, Juneau has a population of 32,000 and last year received a record 1.65
